description: Configuration for the Extended Influence System - defines conviction levels, pool thresholds, and resistance mechanics for NPC belief change

convictionLevels.description: A loosely held view that the NPC hasn't deeply considered. Easily swayed with modest effort.
examples: Casual preference for one tavern over another
Minor superstition picked up from others
Passing opinion about weather patterns
Preference for a particular food or drink
convictionLevels.mechanicsSummary: Base DC 10, threshold 5. No resistance buildup on failure. Can typically be changed in 2-3 interactions.
convictionLevels.narrativeDescription: This belief is held loosely, adopted without much thought. A few well-chosen words should suffice to change their mind.

convictionLevels.description: A considered position with some personal investment. Requires sustained persuasion to change.
examples: Political alignment with a local faction
Professional opinion on trade practices
Trust or distrust of a particular group
Views on proper social etiquette
convictionLevels.mechanicsSummary: Base DC 12, threshold 10. No resistance buildup. Requires 3-5 successful interactions.
convictionLevels.narrativeDescription: The NPC has given this matter some thought and won't be swayed by a single argument. Persistent, consistent reasoning will be needed.

convictionLevels.description: A deeply held view tied to personal experience or values. Resistance grows with failed attempts.
examples: Religious practices and observances
Loyalty to a particular leader or cause
Long-held grudge against an enemy
Professional code of conduct
convictionLevels.mechanicsSummary: Base DC 14, threshold 15. Resistance increases by 1 per 2 failures. Expect 5-8 interactions and possible setbacks.
convictionLevels.narrativeDescription: This belief is woven into the NPC's identity. They will actively resist attempts to change their mind, and clumsy efforts will make them more entrenched.
convictionLevels.warningText: Repeated failures will increase DC. Consider your approach carefully.

convictionLevels.description: A fundamental truth that shapes how the NPC sees the world. Extremely difficult to change.
examples: Devotion to family above all else
Absolute faith in a deity or philosophy
Hatred born from personal tragedy
Oath sworn in blood or before witnesses
convictionLevels.mechanicsSummary: Base DC 16, threshold 20. Resistance increases by 1 per failure. Extended campaign required, high risk of permanent failure.
convictionLevels.narrativeDescription: This belief defines who the NPC is at their core. Challenging it may be seen as a personal attack. Only overwhelming evidence or transformative experiences may succeed.
convictionLevels.warningText: Each failure significantly increases DC. Quest-related events may be required for success.

convictionLevels.description: An absolute certainty that defines the NPC's entire existence. Near-impossible to change through normal means.
examples: Cult-like devotion to a cause or leader
Revenge that has consumed their entire life
Prophecy they believe they must fulfill
Identity-defining trauma response
convictionLevels.mechanicsSummary: Base DC 18, threshold 25. Resistance increases by 2 per failure. Normal influence may be impossible; extraordinary circumstances required.
convictionLevels.narrativeDescription: This isn't a belief—it's the very foundation of their being. Questioning it threatens their entire sense of self. Only cataclysmic events or divine intervention might shake such certainty.
convictionLevels.warningText: Normal persuasion is unlikely to succeed. Consider quest paths or extraordinary measures.

resistanceMechanics.description: How resistance builds and affects influence attempts

stallBehavior.effect: Influence enters Stalled status until external condition is met

active.description: The influence attempt is ongoing. Continue making progress toward changing their belief.

successful.description: The NPC's belief has been changed. New dialogue and options may be available.

failed.description: The NPC is completely resistant. Normal influence can no longer change this belief.

stalled.description: Progress is blocked. An external event or condition must be resolved to continue.

weakOpinion: Focus on making good arguments - failures have no lasting consequence
Two or three successful checks should be sufficient
moderateBelief: Plan for a sustained campaign of 3-5 interactions
Failures don't build resistance, so persistence pays off
strongConviction: Each failure makes the next attempt harder
Consider your arguments carefully before attempting
Look for evidence or events that support your position
coreBelief: This will require significant investment of time and resources
Consider whether quests or events might provide breakthrough moments
Failures significantly increase difficulty - choose your battles wisely
fanatical: Normal persuasion is unlikely to succeed
Look for extraordinary circumstances or divine intervention
Consider whether changing this belief is truly necessary
Quest-related breakthroughs may be the only path forward

attemptSuccess.lowProgress: Your words find purchase. {target} seems slightly more receptive to your perspective.
attemptSuccess.mediumProgress: You're making real progress. {target} is genuinely considering your arguments.
attemptSuccess.highProgress: You can see doubt forming in {target}'s eyes. Their conviction is wavering.
attemptSuccess.breakthrough: {target}'s expression shifts. You've broken through their resistance.

attemptFailure.noResistanceGain: Your argument falls flat, but {target} doesn't seem more entrenched.
attemptFailure.resistanceGain: {target}'s jaw sets. Your approach has made them more resistant to future attempts.
attemptFailure.nearStall: {target} is becoming increasingly defensive. Much more pressure could stall your efforts entirely.
attemptFailure.stalled: {target} shuts down completely. Further attempts will require a different approach.

convictionChanged.weakOpinion: {target} shrugs and nods. 'You know what? You're right.'
convictionChanged.moderateBelief: {target} pauses thoughtfully. 'I... hadn't considered it that way. Perhaps you have a point.'
convictionChanged.strongConviction: {target} lets out a long breath. 'I've held this belief for years, but your arguments... I cannot deny them.'
convictionChanged.coreBelief: {target}'s voice trembles. 'Everything I thought I knew... you've shown me a different truth.'
convictionChanged.fanatical: {target} falls to their knees, shaken to their core. 'My entire life... was built on a lie?'
